node.title: House overwhelmingly passes bill banning Russian oil imports
node.description: Measure is largely symbolic since President Biden has already done the same thing but it shows the lawmakers' resolve. Some GOP senators want even tougher legislation.

node.title: Netball: Mystics borrow rival player to get on court
node.description: The Stars have lent the Mystics one of their wider squad members to help get the defending champions on court for the start of the ANZ premiership this weekend.

node.title: Parliament unanimously passes Russia Sanctions Bill
node.description: Parliament has unanimously passed historic sanctions legislation in response to Russia's war on Ukraine.

node.title: 'Milestone in polar history': Expedition locates Shackleton's ship
node.description: Explorers and researchers have located Endurance, Ernest Shackleton's ship that sank in the Antarctic in 1915.

node.title: Australia's military to grow by nearly 20,000 people by 2040
node.description: Australia's military will move towards a wartime footing under government plans to boost the number of uniformed personnel to almost 80,000 by 2040, amid strategic risks posed by China and Russia.

node.title: D.C. officer who died by suicide after Jan. 6 attack has death recognized as "in the line of duty"
node.description: The ruling comes after a yearlong fight by the officer's widow to reverse an earlier decision denying the recognition of a line-of-duty death.

node.title: Refining NZ ripe for investors when it transitions to Channel Infrastructure - report
node.description: The country's three major oil companies will be tempted to sell their shares in Refining NZ as it moves from processing crude to storage making it a ripe takeover target, according to Forsyth Barrâ€¦

node.title: ACC staffer breached client privacy after snooping in sensitive claim - ICRA
node.description: ACC has apologised to an abuse survivor after an employee breached her privacy by looking at her sensitive claim while investigating her husband for suspected fraud.

node.title: Barrett back for Blues, Tuivasa-Sheck sidelined
node.description: All Blacks first-five Beauden Barrett will make his first start of the Super Rugby season for the Blues, but they are without Roger Tuivasa-Sheck due to injury.

node.title: Ukraine war: Sumy civilians leave in first successful mass evacuation
node.description: Thousands of residents from the north-eastern Ukrainian city of Sumy were successfully evacuated after Russia agreed to pause attacks and evacuation corridors opened.

node.title: 'Fairly big and fairly chunky': Zoologist excited by extinct duck discovery
node.description: A new species of large, extinct duck has been discovered at one of the country's richest fossil sites in St Bathans in Otago. Audio

node.title: Up to 6,000 Russians may have been killed in Ukraine, U.S. official estimates
node.description: The official stressed that the death toll is difficult to assess in real time, but still called them "very, very significant casualties."

node.title: Florida House passes bill creating office to probe election crimes
node.description: The bill now heads to Gov. Ron DeSantis, who's expected to sign it into law.

node.title: RNZ, TVNZ to be folded into new mega public media entity
node.description: RNZ and TVNZ will be subsidiaries of a new mega public media organisation, Broadcasting Minister Kris Faafoi has confirmed. Watch the announcement live here. Video

node.title: Financial feasibility of income insurance scheme under review
node.description: Accountants are taking a close look at the government's proposed income insurance scheme, to see how the costs versus benefits stack-up.

node.title: MCC make changes to cricket rules
node.description: Cricketers will not be allowed to use saliva to shine the ball while the "Mankad" dismisal will not be listed under unfair play in new laws.

node.title: Inflation or "corporate greed"? Meat prices increased by double digits during pandemic
node.description: Some say pandemic disruptions, inflation and high demand are to blame for price increases. Others question whether there's more at play.

node.title: Ministry announces change to reporting of Covid-19-related deaths
node.description: Director-General of Health Ashley Bloomfield says the Ministry of Health will be changing how it reports Covid-19-related deaths from today.

node.title: Detecting early signs of dementia crucial to stopping it developing, researcher says
node.description: The head of a long-term dementia study hopes it will help to diagnose the disease before symptoms appear.

node.title: Serco's psychological evaluation of inmates 'very poor' - Parole Board Chair
node.description: Serco has been criticised for using interns to write psychological reports for the Parole Board.

node.title: MLB cancels more games as owners, players fail to reach deal
node.description: A key issue is the creation of an international draft, which the league is pushing for but the players' union opposes.

node.title: Temel Atacocugu to continue Walk for Peace after hospital stay
node.description: Christchurch mosque massacre survivor Temel Atacocugu is being discharged from Timaru Hospital today and will continue his journey from Dunedin to Christchurch.

node.title: Homicide investigation launched after man found dead near Nelson
node.description: A homicide investigation has been launched after a man was found dead at a rural property in Hope, near Nelson.

node.title: Nearly 50% of children presenting at Middlemore emergency department have Covid
node.description: Auckland hospitals are dealing with far more Covid patients than they predicted in even their worst case scenarios.

node.title: "Darkness kills," say advocates for permanent Daylight Saving Time
node.description: "Darkness in the evening is far deadlier than darkness in the morning," University of Washington professor Steve Calandrillo told Congress.

node.title: Legal workers point to bullying, workloads and unpaid overtime for poor mental health
node.description: A majority of legal workers are suffering from poor mental health due to work pressures, a survey has found.

node.title: Bread price hike expected as Ukraine war puts pressure on global wheat supply
node.description: The price of bread in New Zealand is set to rise as Russia's invasion of Ukraine puts pressure on global wheat prices.

node.title: Pandemic increases demand for deer velvet
node.description: Strong demand for deer velvet has pushed up returns for farmers 20 percent higher than last season.

node.title: Stunning photos of climate change
node.description: These images paint a startling picture of the environmental changes afoot across the globe as temperatures rise.

node.title: Pfizer plans no further investment in Russia, says CEO Albert Bourla
node.description: Bourla doesn't anticipate supply disruptions resulting from the conflict.
